
Building OpenCV for Android with contrib modules (aruco) - on Linux:
	Android NDK:
		install AndroidNDK from https://developer.android.com/ndk/downloads/index.html
		set env var ANDROID_NDK="path/to/android-ndk"

	open CMake GUI:
		set src location to AugmentedUnreality/ThirdParty/opencv/src/opencv
		set build location to AugmentedUnreality/ThirdParty/opencv/build/Android
		add key:
			ANDROID_NATIVE_API_LEVEL = "19"
		click "Configure"
			-> specify toolchain for cross compiling
			-> choose: AugmentedUnreality/ThirdParty/opencv/src/opencv/platforms/android/android.toolchain.cmake

		set additional modules = AugmentedUnreality/ThirdParty/opencv/src/opencv_contrib/modules
		set WITH_CUDA = false
		set install prefix = AugmentedUnreality/ThirdParty/opencv/install/Android

		click "Generate"

	build:
		cd AugmentedUnreality/ThirdParty/opencv/src/opencv/build/Android
		make install -j8

Building AugmentedUnreality for Android - on Windows:
	Install Android tools for UE: https://docs.unrealengine.com/latest/INT/Platforms/Android/GettingStarted/1/index.html

	Prepare project in editor:
		Project Settings -> Platforms -> Android
			APK Packaging -> click "Configure Now"
			Min SDK version = 19
			Target SDK version = 19

		Refresh VS project
		Close editor

	Build in VS:
		switch Platform = Android
		switch Configuration = Development
			(not Development Editor)

		click "Build -> Build Solution"

	Connect Android device:
		https://docs.unrealengine.com/latest/INT/Platforms/Android/GettingStarted/2/index.html
